definition: to scamper off/to scurry off like a frightened rat
rat/mouse/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously

sentences.english: Taking advantage of the enemy's wrong strategic move, we sent them fleeing in disorder.
sentences.chinese: 我们利用了敌军的错误战略部署把他们打得抱头鼠窜。

sentences.english: Seeing that the enemy were many, they ran away.
sentences.chinese: 看到敌人人多势众，他们抱头鼠窜了。

sentences.english: Arrived another place, is again frighten by light flee ignominiously.
sentences.chinese: 到了另一处，又被灯光吓得抱头鼠窜。

definition: to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to flee/to run away
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
to scatter in all directions
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
in a panic/flurried
to flee in defeat/to bolt
the wolf runs and the wild boar rushes (idiom); crowds of evil-doers mill around like wild beasts
to put one's hands behind one's head, fingers interlaced/to hold one's head in one's hands (in dismay, fright etc)/to cover one's head with one's hands (for protection)
to scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/to flee in all directions
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
convulsed with fear (idiom)
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
to flee at the mere sight of (idiom)
